intro: Schoberia setigera, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Schoberia setigera is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
